newsitem.title: USA: Canadian spot gas prices rise again with NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: Canadian spot gas prices rise again with NYMEX.

text.p: Canadian spot natural gas prices continued to rise Thursday on the heels of a stronger futures market and short supplies in Alberta, traders said.

Spot gas at Alberta's AECO storage hub was pegged one cent higher at C$1.48 per gigajoule. September AECO gas rose about three cents to C$1.43 per GJ, while October business was quoted at C$1.51-1.52.
"This market repeats itself over and over," one Calgary-based trader said, noting prices were continuing their gradual uptick.
At Sumas, Wash., prices were also slightly higher around $1.20 per million British thermal units (mmBtu), traders said.
In the East, Niagara pricing continued to follow the lead of NYMEX, regaining more than 10 cents to about $2.66-2.69 per mmBtu.
NYMEX's September futures stretched to a high of $2.55 today, up 7.8 cents from Wednesday's settlement.
